examples: Bad manners will get you nowhere.
The teacher praised the students for their good manners.
The old gentleman may have a stern manner, but his heart is in the right place
He had to keep his large family in the manner he had chosen.
Minding your manners is a two way street.
words.defineEn: the way a person acts or behaves toward others
words.defineVi: cách một người hành động hoặc cư xử đối với người khác

examples: When traveling to a new country, it's important to research local customs and etiquette to avoid unintentionally offending others, as they say, so many countries, so many customs.
They teach etiquette, language, culture.
Basically, a healthy nervous system has the etiquette of electrical messaging down to, well, a science.
Over time, the study of ballet became a central element of court life, and proper grasp of the etiquette could make or break one's success as a courtier.
I wanted to teach hearing and abled people the proper etiquette when it comes to encountering people like us.
words.defineEn: a set of conventional rules or formal manners, usually in the form of ethical code
words.defineVi: một tập hợp các quy tắc thông thường hoặc cách cư xử chính thức, thường ở dạng quy tắc đạo đức

words.defineEn: the ability to understand and respect the traditions, values, regular activities, etc. of the people from a different culture
words.defineVi: khả năng hiểu và tôn trọng các truyền thống, giá trị, các hoạt động thường xuyên, v.v. của những người đến từ một nền văn hóa khác

words.defineEn: the way of eating that is expected of people to follow when with others
words.defineVi: cách ăn uống mà mọi người mong muốn làm theo khi ở cùng người khác

examples: The CEO emphasized the importance of punctuality in their company, stating that punctuality is the soul of business.
The CEO emphasized the importance of punctuality in their company, stating that punctuality is the soul of business.
words.defineEn: the habit or characteristic of being consistently on time
words.defineVi: thói quen hoặc đặc điểm của việc luôn đúng giờ

examples: As a general rule, it is considered impolite to ask someone about their salary or age, as the proverb goes, 'never reveal a man's wage and woman's age'.
Anything else is very impolite.
I don't like impolite students.
See, you are impolite, and you don't respect others.
Why is that impolitic or impolite?
words.defineVi: có cách cư xử hoặc hành vi xấu

examples: The celebrity had to eat crow and apologize for her offensive comments after facing backlash from the public and media.
Upon seeing the offensive graffiti, a look of grimace crossed his face.
When I asked my grandfather how much sleep he got each night, he replied, 'six hours' sleep for a man, seven for a woman, and eight for a fool,' which I found surprising and somewhat offensive.
By 1917, they're making an offensive.
Yeah, that's very offensive.
words.defineEn: describing something that is upsetting or disrespectful
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó là khó chịu hoặc thiếu tôn trọng

examples: Is that customary for most psychiatrists?
It’s actually customary to toss out that night’s data.
In some places, it's customary to go up to twelve on just one hand.
It is somewhat customary for a president at the end of their term to issue a slew of orders.
It is somewhat customary for a president at the end of their term to issue a slew of orders.
words.defineEn: commonly done or practiced within a specific situation, place, or society
words.defineVi: thường được thực hiện hoặc thực hành trong một tình huống, địa điểm hoặc xã hội cụ thể

examples: No subject is taboo.
One driver of this language change is taboo.
Forbidden taboo thoughts.
- was disgusting, taboo.
For centuries, the dissection of human bodies was very taboo in many societies.
words.defineEn: a topic, term, or action that is forbidden or avoided for religious or cultural reasons
words.defineVi: một chủ đề, thuật ngữ hoặc hành động bị cấm hoặc tránh vì lý do tôn giáo hoặc văn hóa
